result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra A Cravillion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with K.M.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Must inform any health care provider of this conviction.  Must have DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: 60 days stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Sentence can be served in Kewaunee County. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county. Huber release granted. Jail time is to be coordinated with Dept. of Corrections and the Jail. Sentence can be served on electronic monitoring.
To perform 30 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

Defendant Debra A Cravillion in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Debra A Cravillion in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates they received an offer from the State and defendant is not willing to accept the offer at this point.  Atty Reetz requests another status in April to see if something can be worked out to resolve matter. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file their discovery demand later this week.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
